intro: Tissa stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit tissa, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. Its fruit is a capsule that matures into a woody structure, containing several seeds. Tissa stenocarpa is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
